reviews.sentence: Not worth the money. This hotel is not worth the money. The beds here are terrible and seem worn out. The linens on the bed were lumpy like they had been washed and the stuffing was balled up inside. When we asked about new linens the staff told us they were all like that. My wife was not happy to say the least. I have stayed in rooms in the 50 per night range with better accommodations than this Hampton Inn.

An overnight stay. The staff of this hotel seems to have just the right knack for making your stay a very pleasant experience. The greeting at registraton was very warm followed by a delicious chocolate chip cookie. The room was very well appointed and the bed most comfortable. The room as also very clean and the heating cooling system was in perfect working order. The breakfast served as part of the room price was hot and nurishing with a wide selection of choices. Better than most. The staff in the dining area was most pleasant and very willing to be of help if needed. Upon exiting our room with suitcases the maid cleaning the room across the hall popped her head around the corner of the door and said thank you for staying with us. How often has that ever happened. Check out was a breeze because our bill had been slipped under the door. We were thanked again by the desk folks for staying with them and we were told to come back anytime.

Really Good Hampton good location poor neighborhood. Clean room friendly and fast front desk. Room was neat and clean even smelled nice. No problems with anything. Plenty of parking but a little tight for a truck. The problem was limited dining close just drive south a few miles on I71 and you have all you want. Right next door was the Liquor Inn not a real good looking place some homeless guys hanging around but they stayed over in that lot and did not even look our way. Honestly I felt totally safe walking around it just seemed alright. If you want easy access to downtown this is the place to stay. Breakfast was the same so so food Hampton is famous for but the staff was nice and the food way hot and plentiful.

Great location Comfortable room. This was a stopping point on a road trip. The location was great. close to MainStrase and historic Covington. We had a great view from our window of the Ohio River. The bed was comfortable. The breakfast was great. my daughter loved the waffles. The only hotel in the area with free parking.

Fine hotel. Booked this hotel for one night in the weekend it was completely fun. Breakfast area is a bit too small when there are a lot of guest. Room is nice with good bed. Service is OK. Bedroom is well equipped and clean.

Good place to stay 2 mile walk from Great American Ballpark. Had a goo stay here for baseball games. Hotel room was clean and in good shape. We arrived before check in because going to game at 1230 but staff was helpful and let us go ahead and check in since they had rooms ready. That was a plus for me. did not know if I would have time between doubleheader games. Pros Clean and good shape rooms. Good location. Good staff help Cons Pool water was extremely cold. My cousins kid said it was too cold for him and that is odd. No towels in pool area had to get from front desk. Farther from things than a few other hotels.

Great stay for Cin Childrens Hospital Guests. The hotel was very accommodating friendly and helpful. there were lots of other kids there visiting the hospital and the staff made everyone comfortable and welcome. The lobby was a great place to meet and eat outside of the room. Fresh fruit and coffee were always available.

Great handicapped accessible room. Great room for a wheelchair user. Plenty of space to maneuver and an easy to use roll in shower. The only problem was using a lift to get my wife in and out of the bed. The sagging box springs interfered with the legs of the lift but I am sure that will be repaired as soon as they read this review.

Nice Place Close to Everything. Really had a nice stay here. Rooms were clean and check in very quick. Pool was a little cool but we used it to relax. Overall a very good place to stay and close to everything in the area. Quiet area but close to all on the river. We went on a riverboat dinner cruise just a beautiful sunset and evening. Updating rooms.

Great hotel close to the stadium. A quick jump on the trolley will get you to the game and back. Hotel was great BUT the bed had hair and bugs on it. Staff moved us to a new room immediately and discounted our room charge. Great hotel minus the unfortunate experience with the bed.

Easy access to Riverfront activities. You can easily get where you want to go in either Cincinnati or Northern Kentucky from this hotel. Rooms were well tended free YFi full breakfast and superb Manager. I especially liked the river view and night traffic over the nearby I75 bridge. The thick window glass blocks the sound for a good nights sleep. Very comfy bed.

My small family does nt take many vacations but we stayed here on our 1st mini vaca easter weekend. My son lost is first tooth the 1st day we were in Cincy. I thought I had it placed well but did not and a person in housekeeping was picking up and it fell out. She was so nice not to throw it out. it was in tinfoil and placed it up by the TV with note. I told a woman at the service desk to give the housekeeping a huge thank you to Megan. I hope she gets some recognition and was informed of my complete gratitude. Not to mention the room and everyone we came in contact with was extremely helpful and nice.
Disappointing. no chairs only one desk chair. Was enough room for a table and at least one more chair. more pool supervision and cleanup.

One of our best vacations by far hands down for a couple years. Brittany in housekeeping was excellent we never ran out of towels and she always accommodated our schedule. Our room looked and smelled fresh and clean from the say we came to the say we left. Also the breakfast was hot and fresh each mornings not sure the ladys name maybe robin or rosie but she was very nice and helpful as well. We come to cincinnati to visit family at least once a year and plan on staying here again in the future. Money well spent for a very relaxing week. THANKS TO THE Hampton riverfront staff for their excellent hospitality Sincerely a very satisfied guest.

Excellent Getaway. In the area for a wedding reception and decided to book a room for both a romantic night out of the house away from the kids and to not risk driving impaired. Aside from a slow Wi Fi connection which was not important to us for this visit the hotel was perfect for our needs. Breakfast was good.

Quick trip to Cincinnati. We were heading through town and want to stop off a the Cincinnati Zoo. We checked into options around the zoo and found that slightly farther away we could save on the room rate. We prefer Hampton Inn but are not always able to find one close. We stopped and were greeted politely and checked into our room. It was clean and comfortable.

Tired hotel room 623. This Hampton has the normal amenities breakfast and refrigerator. The inn is old and needs updating. The carpet has seen better days and could stand replacing. Bathe King mattress was softer than I normally find at a Hampton I like the firmness. There is no shuttle to get you into Ohio if you need access to events across the river. Uber is a good option but makes the total cost much more. When I checked in the tub had used soap and towels in the tub so disappointing.

Easy Locale from Downtown Cincinnati. Everything I thought it would be. Close clean and easy to navigate to from downtown and off to the Bourbon Trail. You stay at Hamptons because they offer a great breakfast with the room and this was no exception.

Created a Trip Advisor Account just to write this review. This Hampton was below par and should be in jeopardy of losing the Hilton brand. I am a loyal Hilton patron and a silver honors member. I have stayed at nearly every kind of Hilton including several Hamptons. The Hampton in Covington was without a doubt the worst experience I ever had in any Hilton hotels. Let me first say that this experience will in no way deter me from visiting another Hilton. Overall I am happy with Hilton hotels. And even when something goes wrong I have never seen a need memorialize it on an online review. However as the title states I created an account on Trip Advisor solely to express my discontent with this hotellet us begin with the cleanliness. There were several issues most for which I have provided photographs. First when I checked in on Thursday night November 17 2016 I noticed a very small brown stain on the white bedspread. I assume that I do not need to speculate on what this could have been. It was so late in the evening that I decided to put the bedspread on the floor and to sleep without it. The next morning the housekeeper was in the hallway and I informed her of the situation. She very politely advised me to report this issue to management as it would certainly result in a free nights stay. I thanked her but declined to report the issue. Let me reiterate the housekeeper could not have been more friendly. I do not have a photograph to support this claim. Second there was some sort of a disgusting stain on the wall. For this please refer to the picture titled Photo 1Third as Photo 2 will show the front of the air conditioning heating unit did not close. I had to wedge the waste basket in between the AC unit and the desk in order to keep the unit at least mostly closed. Photo 3 will show further issues with the AC unit specifically the lack of attention given to the cleanliness of its exterior. The filth on the side of the unit easily accessible with a feather duster had quite obviously been collecting for months. The final issue on the AC heating unit was its functionality. The thermostat when the unit is on heating mode is not functioning. So yes the never shuts off. This poses quite a problem in the overnight hours. My routine was to get the room warm enough before bed turn off the unit and sleep as the room cooled overnight. Mornings were brisk to say the least. Forth Photo 4 reveals another issue of cleanliness lack of attention to detail. This is a picture of the vent in the bathroom. Notice the dust and filth that has built up. This is what customers are breathing in. Fifth Photo 5 shows that there is no knob on top of the lamp. This issue alone would never have warranted a negative review. However when combined with everything else it certainly shows that cleanliness and attention to the small things are not priorities when management is training the housekeeping staff. To add to the misery this hotel was under construction which started promptly at 80 every morning. However there were signs posted everywhere advising guests of this inconvenience and so I do not place blame here. It just added to a negative experience. I am not a negative review person. I am a professional who tends to see the good in people. I chose to not ask for a free night when I discovered the horror on my bedspread. because that is not the kind of person I am nor do I wish to be that kind of person. However this Hampton has a duty not only the Hilton brand but also to the customer who has become accustomed to a certain level of professionalism and quality when staying at a Hilton hotel. Neither of those important aspects of the hotel industry were achieved at my stay not even close.
Location was easy to get to but not a good view. Excellent breakfast though and all staff was very friendly.
Fair. Very noisy rooms have very poor sound insulation sounded like there were people in our room all night.

Great place to stay for the value. Room was very nice. Like the lighting in the bathroom and the fog roof mirror. Water pressure was nice. Shower was n’t updated but it was very clean and had great water pressure.
Pleasant. The room was too small for 4 people.

The room was large but next to elevators. The bathroom was also roomy. The shower was difficult to use since room was handicap accessible. The shower head would not spray the right direction unles using as hand held wand. Difficult to hold while trying to wash hair. the breakfast was very good with sausage eggs potato pancakes French toast sticks and the usual breads and cereal. Quick and easy freeway access.

The staff was amazing. I got there early and they let me check in anyway. The free breakfast was spectacular. Red skin potatoes scrambled eggs with cheese and sausage links. All of them were fresh. There were cinnamon rolls cereal and the normal stuff too. I left something behind in the room and did not realize it until I was almost home 5 hours away. I called them and housekeeping found it and overnighted it to me via Fedex. Overall it was the best stay of my vacation. And the price was very good for a Friday night.

Best Western exceeds expectations. The beds were very comfortable. The room was large enough to walk around the beds and have some room besides. The TV remote had a sleeve on it indicated it had been cleaned. The sink in the bathroom had shelves under it to help with organizing things in the bathroom. The water pressure was great. The breakfast had excellent choices for everyone. There was everything from sliced cantaloupe to sausage. They had french toast sticks and potato pancakes. Scrambled eggs and cheesy scrambled eggs. The breakfast person kept the breakfast items stocked very efficiently. The hotel is located right off the interstate just south of the river dividing Ohio and Kentucky. Very convenient to Cincinnati or attractions in Kentucky. It was about 40 minutes to the Ark Encounter and 20 minutes to the Creation Museum.

Exceptional. Breakfast was good. Love that they had fruit and other options to choose from. Hotel is very clean. Rooms are clean. Nice area. No issue with anything. I would stay here againThe room did nt have booklets pamphlets with info in the room like other hotels usually have. There was nt a direct button on the phone to call the front desk.

Good. The room was very nice. Loved having the fridge. Staff was very friendly and helpful and bed was comfortable. We had the room right next to the elevator and the rooms were not very sound proof. Aside from location the Individuals in the neighboring room were in and out with the door slamming shut until 2 in the morning and running up and down the hall. You could hear everything and we had an infant. It was rough.

Otherwise it was alright. Most was fine. Booked for 2 queen beds but got a king with a pull out bed. I realized I got checked in early and was going to a baseball game. did not want to complain. See above. People sitting outside elevator rooms talking so loud.

Exceptional. Facility was very nice and clean. Modern. Prompt desk help. Pool was clean a tad cold but my kids did n’t mind. Happy hour meet and greet was nice 2 free beers or soft drinks per an adult and free soft pretzels with cheese. Games for the kids and coloring pages. Breakfast the next morning was huge and fresh. Bathrooms were large and comfortable. Loved the pig out front of the hotel. Will definitely stay here again with our family. Bathroom sink drains were slow but not a major issue. Overheard employees saying there was a drain issue with the plumbing and they had someone on the way to work on fixing whatever the issue was.
